availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Buford Duke (Mason County, Kentucky, student)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, student and clerk. Kentucky native. Son of John M. Duke and Hannah Duke. Attended school in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Student in Mason County in 1860. Household owned four enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860. Clerk in Mason County in September 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 104B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 313.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 5A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Mason County, KY, September 1863, p. 77.
"Charles Buford Duke (1840-1901)," Find A Grave, Memorial 228454671, accessed May 2, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/228454671.
